alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Bath (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 12:36PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Virginia and southeast West Virginia, including the following counties, in west central Virginia, Alleghany VA and Bath. In southeast West Virginia, Greenbrier. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1236 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Jackson River, Brushy Lick, Anthony Creek, Boggs Run, Falling Spring Creek, Hoover Creek, Cedar Creek, Fleming Run, Big Run, Greenbrier River and Coles Run. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Neola... Natural Well... Alvon... Callison... Carloover... Rorer... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
